title: ARM64 version not available on Microsoft Store
content:
I have recently migrated my Firefox install from Mozilla's website to Microsoft Store, and I have noticed it installs the 32bit version on my Surface Pro X. But through Mozilla, I can get the ARM64 version.

Will the Microsoft Store install offer an ARM64 version, or will it be available only through Mozilla?

title: Username refuses to remain populated on a particulare web page
content: An email server I check each day (https://signin.att.com) is no longer auto-populating my user name (email address), however the password still auto-populates correctly. I have ensured that the 'Autofill logins and passwords' box is checked in Firefox settings. I've deleted and reentered my user name and password for the above site within Firefox settings 3 times and reentered them. Each time, when logging back in to the site after previously deleting my user and password, a box (from Firefox) appears displaying the password I've just entered, but not my user name (clue?). I then enter my user name and save. When I check my password list, both my user name and password for the above site are shown. However, when I log out and back in again on the above site, my user name is again not listed. I can access the above site on my iPad and the user name always appears, so I'm assuming that this is a Firefox issue. Can anyone help me resolve this? - Thank you.
creator: Placerville

title: Facebook scrolls to bottom of page when I type a reply to a comment or use Shift or Backspace keys
content:
I've tried going in safe mode, turning of my Facebook container. Deleting cache. Signing out of Facebook. Also adjusting the backspace key in my Config. Having no problems on my Android phone or when using Opera. It's on on Firefox and on Facebook. 

FACEBOOK screen suddenly moves to the bottom of the screen when I am typing a comment. Whenever I hit SHIFT+alpha_letter at the beginning of a line OR simply hit the backspace key, the screen suddenly shifts to the very bottom of the page again even if I have tried to scroll the page back up to the middle of the screen manually. This shifts the entry area where I'm typing down and sometimes off of the visible screen entirely. Just hitting the backspace to correct a typo causes the screen to scroll on its own. I have to scroll back down to the entry box and if I make another typo, it happens again.

Please help. Been going on for over two weeks. I was hoping the new Firefox update yesterday would help. Nope. Still happening.
creator: fu22

title: Maximized Firefox window leaks to other monitors
content:
Hi, a long-standing problem is this: When Firefox is maximized in one monitor (the lowest one on my setup), the top of the Firefox window is leaked into the upper monitors by 10 pixels (if I see it correctly).

This only happens in the default setting of "Title bar" = unchecked (in the Customize Firefox settings). If "Title bar" is checked, then the window shrinks a little to fit the current monitor (just like a maximized window should be).

Is there a way to get Firefox to stay within the monitor limits when maximized even if Title bar is disabled?

Thunderbird does the same, but I guess they are using same components inside. No other programs have this problem.

Windows 10 21H2, using 175% or 100% display scaling, depending on the monitor (they are all 2560x1440 but the lower one is 14" (with 175% scaling) and the upper monitors are 27" (with 100% scaling)).

(The image upload does not seem to work, I'll send this anyway and try to add the screenshots in a reply.)
creator: markkul

title: Voglio installare l'ultima versione di Firefox che prevede il pulsante home di default sulla barra degli strumenti, o indirizzi.  E anche bloccare gli aggiornamenti automatici!!!
content:
''''Sono sull'orlo di una crisi di nervi e dell'abbandono del browser Mozilla.''''

Voglio poter fare un downgrade all'ulltima versione utile che prevede i pulsante home di default su tutte le finestre, o schede, possibili.

Voglioi anche bloccare DEFINITIVAMENTE GLI AGGIORNAMENTI AUTOMATICI.

E VORREI TANTO POTER SPEDIRE ALL'INFERNO QUELL'IDIOTA CHE HA RIMOSSO IL PULSANTE HOME DAL DEFAULT E NE HA RESO QUASI IMPOSSIBILE LA REINTEGRAZIONE.

title: Websites aren't loading in Firefox
content:
Firefox opens but it won't load any websites. There's no indication that the browser is trying to load the webpage when I select a site from my bookmarks or history, or when I type an address directly into the address bar. The new tab screen is also completely blank.

Other browsers are able to load webpages as normal.

I have tried restarting my computer, refreshing Firefox, re-installing Firefox, removing and re-adding Firefox to my firewall access, and creating a new Firefox profile, but the problem persists.

title: lh3.googleusercontent.com shows "SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER" and images using this site can't load.
content:
Just happened last night (using another browser) that it can't load some pictures on Google itself (but YouTube and other websites can load pictures in a flash). The website "lh3.googleusercontent.com" which loads pictures on Google services using this site had a security issue (SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER) and I don't what is the reason why it happened.

I'm not on a corporate environment (on a home environment) and my router (which is connected to my ISP stock modem/Wi-Fi router) has anti-virus enabled.

According to the Firefox error, it says: "The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it."

Here's the certificate error text in question: https://pastebin.com/qnrMDV0L

I know its Google's fault for not fixing the certificate (it expires by May 2022), but I tried searching this error on Google and nothing shows up regarding to the "lh3.googleusercontent" one and I found one issue that is the same but the solution isn't different (link).

I also tried disabling anti-virus and re-enabling proxies but it shows up the same error, so it seems like a new problem regarding to their image content site being unavailable.

I didn't also experimented it on other browsers like Chrome, but on Safari (on my iPhone) the pictures on Google Images sometimes gets sluggy in some cases.

So what was the actual reason why the error came up, that it is supposed to be since Google is a big website, that their 'user content' subsite should work at all times?

Should I also report this error to Google if its an issue on other browsers?
creator: matthewjosephfopalan

title: 97.0.2 (32-bit) update ISSUES
content:
I was working on my computer earlier today. Open FF and it asked to download an new update. I chose yes. A little later I closed out of FF and shortly after that got back into FF and the update installed. Now, windows for any application open and close slowly, almost like they are fading in when opening and fading out when closing.

Additionally, my taskbar, which is set to auto hide, very slowly un-hides and very slowly hides. All this was working fine before the install of FF 97.0.2 (32-bit) and became an issue immediately after the install (i.e., opening FF after downloading and closing FF).

Does anyone have any ideas on what the reason for this issue is? Did some setting get changed? Thanks.

title: various issues with pages appearing blank/half loaded after clicking away
content:
hi, not sure where to start this issue as its been building up over the last 1-2 months more and more. i had brushed it off for a bit but its become quite apparently an issue on Firefox and nothing else.

the main thing is that when i click into different tabs, certain pages turn blank (for example, when i away from Youtube i got back and the page is just white) until i click again. but this also occurs on other pages in a way where anything not present is loaded but scrolling down its blank. this happens a lot with tumblr or twitter, and often times i need to completely refresh to fix it. it often lags too when this happens, the pages being slow to respond. i have had other pages where you need to click or scroll to load feeds (soundcloud for example) where they just wont load the content after i scroll and it remains blank.

i thought it was specific sites and not the browser but its apparent its just firefox. chrome works fine and so does Edge. i have looked at solutions here related to issues with loading but none seem to fit the bill for my issue and arent relevant/dont seem to change things.
creator: alexi23spore

title: When opening a second FF browser window, the cursor does not default to the search box, I have to place it there manually, or change the way I open the extra browser windows
content: When opening a second FF browser window, the cursor does default to being active for input in the search box, I have to place it there manually by mouse click, or change the way I open the 2nd browser window. Let me explain.... I have noticed for a while now that the cursor active position in 2nd, 3rd, and more additional FF browser windows is not placed inside the search box, middle of the page, so when I start typing nothing happens. I have to manually move it to the search box and click it in there, with the mouse. Mildly frustrating? I tried searching on here for some info on why it only happens on extra opened FF windows. Found something about it moving to the URL address bar, but the chosen solution did nothing for my "extra browser windows, cursor not in search box" problem. I am on a Win10 laptop, fully up to date software, and am using FF also fully up to date. Some FF add ons, but I don't think they're the problem, because I've had them installed forever, and this problem seems to be a more recent irritant. Couple of months, at least. So, after doing some testing and trying some modifications in "about:config" parameters cursor/search/tab/windows with no luck, I stumbled on a work around. I have my chosen browsers (and some other apps) pinned to the Windows taskbar for quick access. To start my first FF window, I click the FF icon that's pinned to the taskbar. It starts, and the cursor is active/focued inside the search box, which is what I expect and desire. Now, if I start a second browser window by right clicking the pinned FF taskbar icon, and start a new window by clicking "Open new window", when the window opens, and I start typing (expecting the cursor to be focused inside the search box), nothing happens, no typing input, and I have to stop, and manually click inisde the search box to get the cursor in there, and functional. What I discovered from my casual testing is, if I start a second browser window by right clicking the pinned taskbar FF icon, and select the "Firefox" option to open a new FF browser window, when the new FF window opens, the cursor IS focused and functional inside the search box. I can start typing immediately and the text appears inside the main search box, as expected and desired. I have no idea why the cursor works when I start secondary FF browser windows using the "Firefox" option versus the "Open new window" option when I right click the pinned FF taskbar icon, but it works the way I want it to work which is put the cursor inside the search box middle of the page. Maybe it's "functioning as designed", I don't know. Maybe the FF developer braintrust can figure out why the 2 methods of opening subsequent FF windows produce a different functionality for the placement and input capability of the cursor? I'm just posting this up so that if anyone else is getting frustrated with the "lost cursor in the search box" problem, maybe try starting extra FF windows using the "Firefox" option if you start them by right clicking a pinned FF taskbar icon, like I do. Just thought I'd post it up, as it all struck me as odd, but the work around is simple. :)
creator: MrSensible

title: Firefox browser becoming less and less useful
content:
Hello all, I am a long time Firefox browser user, running Firefox 97, on my Macbook Pro laptop with Catalina 10.15.7 operating system, and I have a question about this website.... I am noticing an alarming number of times, when I come here to ask a question, the pages are shown using a foreign language that I cannot read properly, as well as finding no available options present to translate. Is this intended, or is it something that I am experiencing alone?? Please clarify how to translate the pages to English please, or explain why this would be happening, and Thanks in advance.

I have also noticed recently that Firefox is not a very well trusted browser among sites I visit, and that many features of websites will deny you access, when using Firefox, but can be used perfectly well in Chrome browser, and others. for instance, when I went to check my refund status at the IRS website, it would not work in Firefox, and came back with a message that I was denied access to the server, but when I tried the same exact site in Chrome, I was able to get my refund status just fine. Also, many sites that offer a chat option will not work in Firefox, and if I want to do an online chat session of any kind, I have to do it in Chrome, or some other browser for it to work. this is frustrating because as stated above, I have been a Firefox user for many years, to see now that it is becoming a second class browser. So I ask, is there a way that I can install an older version of Firefox, from maybe a couple of years back, you know when it used ot work well, or will I be forced to upgrade it if I do so?? Again, Thanks i advance!!
creator: zlloyd2
